SR3_EXTRA3.DisplayName: Extra data type 3 stream rate to ground station
SR3_EXTRA3.Description: Stream rate of AHRS, HWSTATUS, SYSTEM_TIME, RANGEFINDER, DISTANCE_SENSOR, TERRAIN_REQUEST, BATTERY2, MOUNT_STATUS, OPTICAL_FLOW, GIMBAL_REPORT, MAG_CAL_REPORT, MAG_CAL_PROGRESS, EKF_STATUS_REPORT, VIBRATION and RPM to ground station

SR3_PARAMS.DisplayName: Parameter stream rate to ground station
SR3_PARAMS.Description: Stream rate of PARAM_VALUE to ground station

SR3_POSITION.DisplayName: Position stream rate to ground station
SR3_POSITION.Description: Stream rate of GLOBAL_POSITION_INT and LOCAL_POSITION_NED to ground station

SR3_RAW_CTRL.DisplayName: Raw Control stream rate to ground station
SR3_RAW_CTRL.Description: Stream rate of RC_CHANNELS_SCALED (HIL only) to ground station

SR3_RAW_SENS.Description: Stream rate of RAW_IMU, SCALED_IMU2, SCALED_IMU3, SCALED_PRESSURE, SCALED_PRESSURE2, SCALED_PRESSURE3 and SENSOR_OFFSETS to ground station

SR3_RC_CHAN.DisplayName: RC Channel stream rate to ground station
SR3_RC_CHAN.Description: Stream rate of SERVO_OUTPUT_RAW and RC_CHANNELS to ground station

STAT_BOOTCNT.Description: Number of times board has been booted

STAT_RESET.Description: Seconds since January 1st 2016 (Unix epoch+1451606400) since reset (set to 0 to reset statistics)

SUPER_SIMPLE.Description: Bitmask to enable Super Simple mode for some flight modes. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable Super Simple Mode

SYSID_ENFORCE.Description: This controls whether packets from other than the expected GCS system ID will be accepted

SYSID_MYGCS.Description: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

SYSID_SW_MREV.Description: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

SYSID_SW_TYPE.Description: This is used by the ground station to recognise the software type (eg ArduPlane vs ArduCopter)

SYSID_THISMAV.DisplayName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
SYSID_THISMAV.Description: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

TELEM_DELAY.Description: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

TERRAIN_ENABLE.Description: enable terrain data. This enables the vehicle storing a database of terrain data on the SD card. The terrain data is requested from the ground station as needed, and stored for later use on the SD card. To be useful the ground station must support TERRAIN_REQUEST messages and have access to a terrain database, such as the SRTM database.

TERRAIN_FOLLOW.Description: This enables terrain following for RTL and LAND flight modes. To use this option TERRAIN_ENABLE must be 1 and the GCS must support sending terrain data to the aircraft. In RTL the RTL_ALT will be considered a height above the terrain. In LAND mode the vehicle will slow to LAND_SPEED 10m above terrain (instead of 10m above home). This parameter does not affect AUTO and Guided which use a per-command flag to determine if the height is above-home, absolute or above-terrain.
TERRAIN_FOLLOW.Values: 0:Do Not Use in RTL and Land,1:Use in RTL and Land

TERRAIN_SPACING.Description: Distance between terrain grid points in meters. This controls the horizontal resolution of the terrain data that is stored on te SD card and requested from the ground station. If your GCS is using the worldwide SRTM database then a resolution of 100 meters is appropriate. Some parts of the world may have higher resolution data available, such as 30 meter data available in the SRTM database in the USA. The grid spacing also controls how much data is kept in memory during flight. A larger grid spacing will allow for a larger amount of data in memory. A grid spacing of 100 meters results in the vehicle keeping 12 grid squares in memory with each grid square having a size of 2.7 kilometers by 3.2 kilometers. Any additional grid squares are stored on the SD once they are fetched from the GCS and will be demand loaded as needed.

THR_DZ.Description: The deadzone above and below mid throttle. Used in AltHold, Loiter, PosHold flight modes

THROW_MOT_START.DisplayName: Start motors before throwing is detected
THROW_MOT_START.Description: Used by THROW mode. Controls whether motors will run at the speed set by THR_MIN or will be stopped when armed and waiting for the throw.

THROW_NEXTMODE.Description: Vehicle will switch to this mode after the throw is successfully completed. Default is to stay in throw mode (18)

THROW_TYPE.Description: Used by THROW mode. Specifies whether Copter is thrown upward or dropped.

TUNE.Description: Controls which parameters (normally PID gains) are being tuned with transmitter's channel 6 knob
TUNE.Values: 0:None,1:Stab Roll/Pitch kP,4:Rate Roll/Pitch kP,5:Rate Roll/Pitch kI,21:Rate Roll/Pitch kD,3:Stab Yaw kP,6:Rate Yaw kP,26:Rate Yaw kD,56:Rate Yaw Filter,55:Motor Yaw Headroom,14:AltHold kP,7:Throttle Rate kP,34:Throttle Accel kP,35:Throttle Accel kI,36:Throttle Accel kD,12:Loiter Pos kP,22:Velocity XY kP,28:Velocity XY kI,10:WP Speed,25:Acro RollPitch kP,40:Acro Yaw kP,45:RC Feel,13:Heli Ext Gyro,38:Declination,39:Circle Rate,41:RangeFinder Gain,46:Rate Pitch kP,47:Rate Pitch kI,48:Rate Pitch kD,49:Rate Roll kP,50:Rate Roll kI,51:Rate Roll kD,52:Rate Pitch FF,53:Rate Roll FF,54:Rate Yaw FF

TUNE_HIGH.Description: The maximum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

TUNE_LOW.Description: The minimum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

VEL_XY_I.Description: Velocity (horizontal) I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired velocity to a target acceleration

VEL_XY_IMAX.Description: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

VEL_XY_P.Description: Velocity (horizontal) P gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

VEL_Z_P.Description: Velocity (vertical) P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

VISO_POS_X.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera X position offset
VISO_POS_X.Description: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

VISO_POS_Y.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera Y position offset
VISO_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

VISO_POS_Z.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera Z position offset
VISO_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

WP_NAVALT_MIN.Description: This is the altitude in meters above which for navigation can begin. This applies in auto takeoff and auto landing.

WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR.Description: Determines how the autopilot controls the yaw during missions and RTL
WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR.Values: 0:Never change yaw, 1:Face next waypoint, 2:Face next waypoint except RTL, 3:Face along GPS course

WPNAV_ACCEL.Description: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

WPNAV_ACCEL_Z.Description: Defines the vertical acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

WPNAV_LOIT_MAXA.Description: Loiter maximum acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values cause the copter to accelerate and stop more quickly.

WPNAV_LOIT_MINA.Description: Loiter minimum acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values stop the copter more quickly when the stick is centered, but cause a larger jerk when the copter stops.

WPNAV_LOIT_SPEED.Description: Defines the maximum speed in cm/s which the aircraft will travel horizontally while in loiter mode

WPNAV_RADIUS.Description: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

WPNAV_RFND_USE.Description: This controls the use of a rangefinder for terrain following

WPNAV_SPEED.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

WPNAV_SPEED_DN.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

WPNAV_SPEED_UP.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

ACCEL_Z_D.Description: Throttle acceleration controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

ACCEL_Z_FILT.Description: Filter applied to acceleration to reduce noise. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

ACCEL_Z_I.Description: Throttle acceleration controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

ACCEL_Z_IMAX.DisplayName: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum
ACCEL_Z_IMAX.Description: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

ACCEL_Z_P.Description: Throttle acceleration controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

ACRO_BAL_PITCH.Description: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster.

ACRO_BAL_ROLL.Description: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster.

ACRO_EXPO.Description: Acro roll/pitch Expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

ACRO_RP_P.DisplayName: Acro Roll and Pitch P gain
ACRO_RP_P.Description: Converts pilot roll and pitch into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO and SPORT mode. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

ACRO_TRAINER.Description: Type of trainer used in acro mode

ACRO_YAW_P.Description: Converts pilot yaw input into a desired rate of rotation. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

AHRS_COMP_BETA.DisplayName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient
AHRS_COMP_BETA.Description: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

AHRS_EKF_TYPE.DisplayName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
AHRS_EKF_TYPE.Description: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation

AHRS_GPS_GAIN.Description: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

AHRS_GPS_MINSATS.Description: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

AHRS_GPS_USE.Description: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

AHRS_ORIENTATION.Description: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

AHRS_RP_P.Description: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

AHRS_TRIM_X.Description: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

AHRS_TRIM_Y.Description: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

AHRS_WIND_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

AHRS_YAW_P.Description: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

ANGLE_MAX.Description: Maximum lean angle in all flight modes

ARMING_ACCTHRESH.Description: Accelerometer error threshold used to determine inconsistent accelerometers. Compares this error range to other accelerometers to detect a hardware or calibration error. Lower value means tighter check and harder to pass arming check. Not all accelerometers are created equal.

ARMING_CHECK.Description: Checks prior to arming motor. This is a bitmask of checks that will be performed before allowing arming. The default is no checks, allowing arming at any time. You can select whatever checks you prefer by adding together the values of each check type to set this parameter. For example, to only allow arming when you have GPS lock and no RC failsafe you would set ARMING_CHECK to 72. For most users it is recommended that you set this to 1 to enable all checks.
ARMING_CHECK.Values: 0:None,1:All,2:Barometer,4:Compass,8:GPS Lock,16:INS(INertial Sensors - accels & gyros),32:Parameters(unused),64:RC Channels,128:Board voltage,256:Battery Level,1024:LoggingAvailable,2048:Hardware safety switch,4096:GPS configuration
ARMING_CHECK.Bitmask: 0:All,1:Barometer,2:Compass,3:GPS lock,4:INS,5:Parameters,6:RC Channels,7:Board voltage,8:Battery Level,10:Logging Available,11:Hardware safety switch,12:GPS Configuration

ARMING_MIN_VOLT.DisplayName: Minimum arming voltage on the first battery
ARMING_MIN_VOLT.Description: The minimum voltage on the first battery to arm, 0 disables the check.

ARMING_MIN_VOLT2.DisplayName: Minimum arming voltage on the second battery
ARMING_MIN_VOLT2.Description: The minimum voltage on the first battery to arm, 0 disables the check.

ARMING_REQUIRE.Description: Arming disabled until some requirements are met. If 0, there are no requirements (arm immediately). If 1, require rudder stick or GCS arming before arming motors and sends the minimum throttle PWM value to the throttle channel when disarmed. If 2, require rudder stick or GCS arming and send 0 PWM to throttle channel when disarmed. See the ARMING_CHECK_* parameters to see what checks are done before arming. Note, if setting this parameter to 0 a reboot is required to arm the plane. Also note, even with this parameter at 0, if ARMING_CHECK parameter is not also zero the plane may fail to arm throttle at boot due to a pre-arm check failure.
ARMING_REQUIRE.Values: 0:Disabled,1:THR_MIN PWM when disarmed,2:0 PWM when disarmed

ATC_ANG_LIM_TC.DisplayName: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant
ATC_ANG_LIM_TC.Description: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant

ATC_ANG_LIM_TC.DisplayName: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant
ATC_ANG_LIM_TC.Description: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant

ATC_ANG_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis angle controller P gain
ATC_ANG_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate

ATC_ANG_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis angle controller P gain
ATC_ANG_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate

ATC_ANG_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis angle controller P gain
ATC_ANG_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate

ATC_ANG_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis angle controller P gain
ATC_ANG_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate

ATC_ANG_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis angle controller P gain
ATC_ANG_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate

ATC_ANG_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis angle controller P gain
ATC_ANG_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate

ATC_ANGLE_BOOST.Description: Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude
Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude

ATC_RAT_PIT_D.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain
ATC_RAT_PIT_D.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

ATC_RAT_PIT_FF.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_PIT_FF.Description: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_PIT_FILT.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FILT.Description: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_I.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain
ATC_RAT_PIT_I.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum
ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

ATC_RAT_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain
ATC_RAT_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output

ATC_RAT_RLL_D.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D gain
ATC_RAT_RLL_D.Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

ATC_RAT_RLL_FF.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_RLL_FF.Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_RLL_FILT.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FILT.Description: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_I.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain
ATC_RAT_RLL_I.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum
ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

ATC_RAT_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller P gain
ATC_RAT_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

ATC_RAT_YAW_D.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain
ATC_RAT_YAW_D.Description: Yaw axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

ATC_RAT_YAW_FF.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_YAW_FF.Description: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_YAW_FILT.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FILT.Description: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_I.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain
ATC_RAT_YAW_I.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum
ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

ATC_RAT_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain
ATC_RAT_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw rate and actual yaw rate into a motor speed output

ATC_RATE_FF_ENAB.Description: Controls whether body-frame rate feedfoward is enabled or disabled
Controls whether body-frame rate feedfoward is enabled or disabled

ATC_SLEW_YAW.Description: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in Loiter, RTL, Auto flight modes
Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in Loiter, RTL, Auto flight modes

ATC_THR_MIX_MAN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during manual flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

ATC_THR_MIX_MAX.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during active flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

ATC_THR_MIX_MIN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used when landing (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

AVOID_ANGLE_MAX.DisplayName: Avoidance max lean angle in non-GPS flight modes
AVOID_ANGLE_MAX.Description: Max lean angle used to avoid obstacles while in non-GPS modes

AVOID_DIST_MAX.DisplayName: Avoidance distance maximum in non-GPS flight modes
AVOID_DIST_MAX.Description: Distance from object at which obstacle avoidance will begin in non-GPS modes

BATT_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT_AMP_PERVOLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. On the APM2 or Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

BATT_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATT_CURR_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 12. On the PX4 it should be set to 101. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 3, Pixhawk2 Power2 is 12.

BATT_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

BATT_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick on APM2 or Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX4 using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

BATT_VOLT_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery voltage sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For APM2.x power brick it should be set to 13. On the PX4-v1 it should be set to 100. On the Pixhawk, Pixracer and NAVIO board's PM connector it should be set to 2, Pixhawk2 Power2 is 13.

BATT_WATT_MAX.Description: If battery wattage (voltage * current) exceeds this value then the system will reduce max throttle (THR_MAX, TKOFF_THR_MAX and THR_MIN for reverse thrust) to satisfy this limit. This helps limit high current to low C rated batteries regardless of battery voltage. The max throttle will slowly grow back to THR_MAX (or TKOFF_THR_MAX ) and THR_MIN if demanding the current max and under the watt max. Use 0 to disable.

BATT2_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT2_AMP_PERVOL.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. On the APM2 or Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

BATT2_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATT2_CURR_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 12. On the PX4 it should be set to 101. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 3, Pixhawk2 Power2 is 12.

BATT2_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

BATT2_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick on APM2 or Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX4 using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

BATT2_VOLT_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery voltage sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For APM2.x power brick it should be set to 13. On the PX4-v1 it should be set to 100. On the Pixhawk, Pixracer and NAVIO board's PM connector it should be set to 2, Pixhawk2 Power2 is 13.

BATT2_WATT_MAX.Description: If battery wattage (voltage * current) exceeds this value then the system will reduce max throttle (THR_MAX, TKOFF_THR_MAX and THR_MIN for reverse thrust) to satisfy this limit. This helps limit high current to low C rated batteries regardless of battery voltage. The max throttle will slowly grow back to THR_MAX (or TKOFF_THR_MAX ) and THR_MIN if demanding the current max and under the watt max. Use 0 to disable.

BRD_BRD_IO_ENABLE.Description: This allows for the IO co-processor on FMUv1 and FMUv2 to be disabled

BRD_CAN_BITRATE.Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

BRD_CAN_DEBUG.DisplayName: Level of debug for CAN devices
BRD_CAN_DEBUG.Description: Enabling this option will provide debug messages

BRD_CAN_ENABLE.Description: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

BRD_CAN_UC_EN.Description: Enabling this option starts UAVCAN protocol.

BRD_CAN_UC_NODE.DisplayName: UAVCAN node that is used for Ardupilot
BRD_CAN_UC_NODE.Description: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

BRD_IMU_TARGTEMP.Description: This sets the target IMU temperature for boards with controllable IMU heating units. A value of -1 disables heating.

BRD_PWM_COUNT.Description: Control assigning of FMU pins to PWM output, timer capture and GPIO. All unassigned pins can be used for GPIO
BRD_PWM_COUNT.Values: 0:No PWMs,2:Two PWMs,4:Four PWMs,6:Six PWMs,7:Three PWMs and One Capture

BRD_SAFETY_MASK.DisplayName: Channels to which ignore the safety switch state
BRD_SAFETY_MASK.Description: A bitmask which controls what channels can move while the safety switch has not been pressed

BRD_SAFETYENABLE.DisplayName: Enable use of safety arming switch
BRD_SAFETYENABLE.Description: This controls the default state of the safety switch at startup. When set to 1 the safety switch will start in the safe state (flashing) at boot. When set to zero the safety switch will start in the unsafe state (solid) at startup. Note that if a safety switch is fitted the user can still control the safety state after startup using the switch. The safety state can also be controlled in software using a MAVLink message.

BRD_SBUS_OUT.Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz

BRD_SER1_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 1 (telemetry 1) on Pixhawk. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup. Note that the PX4v1 does not have hardware flow control pins on this port, so you should leave this disabled.

BRD_SER2_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 2 (telemetry 2) on Pixhawk and PX4. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

BRD_SERIAL_NUM.Description: User-defined serial number of this vehicle, it can be any arbitrary number you want and has no effect on the autopilot

BRD_TYPE.Description: This allows selection of a PX4 or VRBRAIN board type. If set to zero then the board type is auto-detected (PX4)
BRD_TYPE.Values: 0:AUTO,1:PX4V1,2:Pixhawk,3:Pixhawk2,4:Pixracer,5:PixhawkMini,6:Pixhawk2Slim,7:VRBrain 5.1,8:VRBrain 5.2,9:VR Micro Brain 5.1,10:VR Micro Brain 5.2,11:VRBrain Core 1.0,12:VRBrain 5.4,13:Intel Aero FC,20:AUAV2.1

BTN0_FUNCTION.Description: Set to 0 to disable or choose a function

BTN0_SFUNCTION.DisplayName: Function for button when the shift mode is toggled on
BTN0_SFUNCTION.Description: Set to 0 to disable or choose a function

BTN1_FUNCTION.Description: Set to 0 to disable or choose a function

BTN1_SFUNCTION.DisplayName: Function for button when the shift mode is toggled on
BTN1_SFUNCTION.Description: Set to 0 to disable or choose a function

BTN10_FUNCTION.Description: Set to 0 to disable or choose a function

BTN10_SFUNCTION.DisplayName: Function for button when the shift mode is toggled on
BTN10_SFUNCTION.Description: Set to 0 to disable or choose a function

BTN11_FUNCTION.Description: Set to 0 to disable or choose a function

BTN11_SFUNCTION.DisplayName: Function for button when the shift mode is toggled on
